p: Bacteria were stored at −80 °C until use. For culturing the bacteria, all bacteria were placed in a nutrient broth base (Difco) for 16–18 h at 37 °C; C. perfringens was grown in an anaerobic vial. The cellular density of the inoculum was measured via optical density at 600 nm for E. coli [ 40], 660 nm for S. aureus [ 41], and 450 nm for C. perfringens using a Multiskan™ GO Spectrophotometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The inoculum was re-diluted in the nutrient broth to obtain the required bacterial concentration.
